words.source: H7503 raphah, Qal wayyiqtol 3ms; KJV 'So he let him go', ESV 'So he let him alone', NASB 'So He let him alone' — raphah means 'to sink, relax, let go'; subject is YHWH
H4480 min, preposition + 3ms suffix; KJV 'him go', ESV 'him alone', NASB 'him alone'
H227 ʾaz, adverb; KJV 'Then', ESV 'At that time', NASB 'At that time'
H559 ʾamar, Qal qatal 3fs; KJV 'she said', ESV 'she said', NASB 'she said'
H2860 chathan, noun ms construct; KJV 'A bloody husband', ESV 'a bridegroom of blood', NASB 'You are a bridegroom of blood' — same debated phrase as v.25
H1818 dam, noun mp; KJV 'bloody', ESV 'of blood', NASB 'of blood'

H4139 mulah, noun fp + preposition le + article; KJV 'because of the circumcision', ESV 'because of the circumcision', NASB 'because of the circumcision' — mulot is plural, possibly indicating the rite or act of circumcision
